Class Company

  • java.lang.Object
    • Company
  • public class Company
extends java.lang.Object
    Container class, represents database list of employees. Methods provided to lookup/add/remove employee, print out employee list, set employee hours, and process payments.
    Author:
    Sagnik Mukherjee, Michael Choe

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private Employee[] emplist  
      private int numEmployee

      Default constructor.

      • emplist

        private Employee[] emplist

        private int numEmployee

    • Constructor Detail

      • Company

        public Company()
        Default constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public boolean add​(Employee employee)
        Adds an employee object to database. Verifies that the profile information is valid.
        Parameters:
        employee - object to be added to the database
        Returns:
        true if add() succeeded, false otherwise

      • find

        private int find​(Employee employee)
        Searches through emplist for an object which matches parameter key.
        Parameters:
        employee - key to be matched to an object within emplist
        Returns:
        integer value which holds the index of the object in emplist

      • grow

        private void grow()
        Grows the database list if the bag container emplist is full. If add() is about to cause an IndexOutOfBoundsException by adding to a full emplist[], grow() should first make room in the array for an employee to be added safely.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Method to determine if this Company is empty.
        Returns:
        true if this.emplist is empty, false otherwise

      • print

        public void print()
        Prints earning statements for all employees.

      • printByDate

        public void printByDate()
        Prints earning statements, sorted by date hired.

      • printByDepartment

        public void printByDepartment()
        Prints earning statements, sorted by department.

      • processPayments

        public void processPayments()
        Processes payments for all employees in database. This is achieved by calling calculatePayment() for each Employee.

      • remove

        public boolean remove​(Employee employee)
        Takes the given Employee object out of database. Maintains original sequence of employee list.
        Parameters:
        employee - object within emplist which will be set to null
        Returns:
        true if remove() succeeded, false otherwise

      • setHours

        public boolean setHours​(Employee employee)
        Sets working hours for a given part-time employee.
        Parameters:
        employee - object whose hoursWorked field will be assigned
        Returns:
        true if setHours() succeeded, false otherwise

      • sortByDate

        private void sortByDate​(Employee[] emplist)
        Helper method for printByDate(). Sorts array in ascending order of date that an Employee was hired.
        Parameters:
        emplist - array containing list of employees

      • sortByDepartment

        private void sortByDepartment​(Employee[] emplist)
        Helper method for printByDepartment(). Sorts array of Employees by department, alphabetically.
        Parameters:
        emplist - array containing list of employees
